title: Can‚Äôt reset the board upon opening level!
text: Been playing since it‚Äôs debut on the App Store and the one thing i loved was being able to open a level and if I didn‚Äôt like it exit out and retry again with out losing a live and boosters. This new update has removed that feature and it will be almost impossible to beat levels with out the use of seeing what the level is like. Fix ASAP pls this is not fair to players that have been here for years!

title: Did you think people were enjoying the game too much?
text: Seriously what were they thinking with this latest patch? That people were enjoying the game too much so they had to make it less so? Not being able to close out a game before making a move and losing a life was a stupid move. I‚Äôm past level 5000 and have little inclination to continue. Not spending the money that‚Äôs for sure. You‚Äôve gone from getting the periodic purchase from me to no spending at all. Giving up on this until you get wise and go back to the way things were. Don‚Äôt mind a hard game but this takes it to the level of waste of time.

title: Used to be a great app...
text:
I have been playing candy crush since it first came out.  In the beginning, it was a slick, solid, clever game that was immediately addictive. But over the last few years it has become a bloated, confusing mess, with a non-sensical number of challenges that you cannot opt out of, and requiring an ever-increasing number of clicks to progress from the end of one game to the beginning of the next.  The developers are clearly focused on manipulating the rules and supposed ‚Äúrandom‚Äù elements of the game (e.g. the end of game wheel spin for additional moves, or the daily booster wheel spin) to drive increased in-app purchases.  The nail in the coffin for me was the recent decision to eliminate the ability to restart a game without penalty prior to making your first move.  I now continually burn boosters that get placed in unusable spots, as I cannot reshuffle the board without losing a life. This makes the game unplayable at higher levels, unless you are willing to spend a lot of money on booster purchases. 

I am done.  I will now move on to other games.  If I hear that King reverses their ‚Äúfix‚Äù to penalize restarts, I may reconsider.

title: Terrible update!

The levels are hard enough with resetting. Hope Candy Crush admin listens to all the fury over this issue and change back.

title: Fun

title: Shame on the developers. I despise what you've done to this game!
text:
Back to ruining the game....Foolishly I keep hoping the next update of Candy Crush Saga will ratify of the damage the previous horrible ‚Äùupdates‚Äù have done to the game. The developers have sucked out all the enjoyment of playing this game unless you're willing to pay a fortune to win a single level. I understand it's a business but the greed is distugisting.   Those in charge of these changes should be ashamed of yourselves. If ‚Äùyou‚Äù started Candy Crush Saga out as this huge money hungry monster it has so quickly become that would have been one thing. I would have been aware of what I was walking into. I would never have spent a dime only to begin with only now to be left feeling robbed for all the money and time I've spent over the years when the prices and game levels play were fair. Your greed makes me eagerly play other games and smile when I make purchases to support their apps.

Now you took away the ‚Äúbuild-a-bot‚Äù from the previous levels! You must hate the people who have played for a while. You keep punishing us. 

2.99 for 30 gold bars... Are you kidding me!!! Thanks for saving me money since I won‚Äôt spend another dime on your app!

title: Booster prices up 33 1/3 to 50%!!!
text:
I used to purchase boosters at least a couple times a week. NO MORE. When they jump pricing this much, they don‚Äôt deserve the money.

Now they‚Äôve changed so boosters are timed and the ones you get aren‚Äôt even useable in your current level. 
2019/12/06
Opened game this evening and they‚Äôve removed the ability to restart a game to get a better board. I‚Äôm done.   Going to uninstall immediately.

title: SuperBanker
text: Company slowly ruined the game over the last twelve months -- if you've played, you'll know what I mean (or see other reviews). For those that haven't started playing the game, don't start (I wish someone told me 18 months ago). I'm actually happy they wrecked it so bad it got me to stop playing (3 days recovering). Anyway, best wishes if you do perhaps start playing (kiss your eyes goodbye).

title: Why remove the replay feature?
text: Removing the option to start a level again without losing a life was a really, really, really dumb idea. No thanks.

title: So disappointed in the reset feature
text:
The reset level feature has been changed. It used to be that you could reset the game by backing out before you made any moves until you had your special candies right where you wanted them. However, now you lose a life by backing out before you even make any moves. They have also done away with the wheel spin for extra moves and special candies for watching an ad. 
I have been a loyal player for 8 years. I loved that the game provided me with the option of paying or playing. I‚Äôve made it all the way to level 4965 without ever paying. I don‚Äôt ever plan to pay. What kept me around was the choice to play using the free opportunities in the game (which have been taken away, as stated above). 
Unfortunately, now my game play will be limited and will ultimately cease because of these ‚Äúnew and improved fixes‚Äù. What a waste of 8 years worth of hard work... I do hope the developers read these comments and reverse the changes. It would show they actually care about their loyal consumers.
